text.title: part1_Wikinews interviews painter Pricasso on his art and freedom of expression

p.hi: How long can you paint with your penis at one time before it gets too tiring?

text.p: Pricasso: At most Sexpo's and Adult Expos I paint for 13 hours a day in half slots so I paint 20 plus paintings a day. When I am painting I have to concentrate hard and go into a meditative state; I don't notice much going on around me until I have finished.

figure.caption: Example of Pricasso applying paint before creating a piece of artwork. Image: Pricasso.

p.hi: Other than your penis, what other parts of your body do you use in the painting process?

text.p: Pricasso: I quickly worked out that I could speed it up by using my testicles and butt cheeks to cover large areas in no time at all, but only recently do I paint the edges using my butt-crack, I call it the credit card swipe!

p.hi: How did you come up with the name Pricasso?

text.p: Pricasso: That was the heading they christened me with in the Picture Magazine interview in 2006. I realised it was Gold and took out the website and trademark.

p.hi: What's the most positive reaction you've had to one of your paintings?

text.p: Pricasso: It is always satisfying to get applause when a painting is finished; at most adult shows this happened all the time; but I do like painting disabled people. I have painted several people with severe cerebral palsy and they are over the moon with the result; this gives me the most pleasure, as I do realise that they are still sexually active people and everyone should realise this.

p.hi: Have any of your paintings been featured in a gallery somewhere?

text.p: Pricasso: I have entered the Bald Archy Exhibition in Australia every year and sold a few. Also at an exhibition of politicians in Australia, and last November I went to Miami for the Art undressed exhibition and also painted 15 minute portraits there which was fun.

p.hi: Do you consider it a form of freedom of expression to create your artwork in the way you do with your penis?

text.p: Pricasso: When I first thought of the idea I was really thinking I could get invited to a few parties as the entertainment which I do regularly, but now I am getting a good style about my work and want to take it to the next level and be accepted as an innovator.
text.hi: A free society throws up these kinds of people, who exercise their freedom in unusual ways.

p.hi: In 2008, prior to a Sexpo event in South Africa, you uploaded a video to the Internet of yourself painting a portrait of then-Mayor of Cape Town Helen Zille. Why did you decide to do this?
